etymology.description: Phonetic: 攸(攸) (yōu, "distant") + Semantic: 木(木) (mù, "wood") = small branch reference -> strip or item
etymology.interpretation: The character 條(條) (tiáo, "strip; item") combines the phonetic element 攸(攸) (yōu, "distant") with the semantic 木(木) (mù, "wood") to convey the idea of a wooden strip or item. This aligns with its meaning related to strips or items made of wood.
etymology.simplification: 条(條) uses a similar top component 攸(攸) from 條(條), with a simplified overall structure but retains phonetic and semantic references.

examples.chinese: 我买了一条裙子(我買了一條裙子)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yī tiáo qúnzi.

examples.chinese: 他在公园看到一条蜥蜴(他在公園看到一條蜥蜴)，迅速跑开(迅速跑開)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài gōngyuán kàn dào yī tiáo xīyì, xùnsù pǎokāi.
examples.english: He saw a lizard in the park and ran away quickly.

examples.chinese: 这本小说分为五条故事线(這本小說分為五條故事線)，各自精彩纷呈(各自精彩紛呈)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn xiǎoshuō fēnwéi wǔ tiáo gùshì xiàn, gèzì jīngcǎi fēnchéng.
examples.english: This novel is divided into five storylines, each wonderfully exciting.
